p:
The impact of any disaster is always long-lasting. Complications of SARS-CoV-2 are unravelling gradually, the most common being ARDS. There is evidence that ARDS contributes to cognitive impairment in several ways – damage to the blood–brain barrier and use of mechanical ventilation being important ones.
130 As more and more patients come out of assisted ventilator support systems, long-term effects on their cognition remain under threat. There is an increased need of rehabilitative services at present. Once this pandemic is over, there will be an increasing demand and strain on the healthcare system regarding the diagnosis and treatment of all the non-emergent conditions, which were put away in the wake of this pandemic.
